revised_title: Exploring Molecular Pressure and the Otheoscope: A New Approach to Studying Radiation
tldr: In this article, William Crookes introduces the Otheoscope, an instrument designed to study molecular pressure generated by radiation. The Otheoscope offers improvements over the Radiometer, allowing for a more precise examination of the effects of radiation on molecular movement. Crookes presents various designs of the Otheoscope and discusses their potential applications in understanding the relationship between force and matter.
